column5: Hey Ryan how did it go dude??? The suspense is killing me
Jaques! I'm still drinking beers out by the fire with the boys! Close to 4500 dollars raised! I'll get the photos and full report off tomorrow! It was an awesome day!
Awesome Ryan    You guys did an excellent job    Enjoy the cold ones cause you deserve it my friend  I'll be keeping an eye out for the full report tomorrow Tight lines Jacques

I had an awesome day today!A little tired now, but it was well worth it! Ryan, my youngest,was happy as can be for her new night gown and lures! Thanks Ryan(and wifie) for welcoming all of us to your home  BTW,the spread was awesome!Why wasnt there any fish on a platter to be served?Being that we are all fisherman/fishergals! HMMMM!
Awesome stuff!!!  Congrats to all!

It was a fun day for a great cause.I would like to thank Ryan and his Family along with all those who helped make this day work out. Fishing was slow but still managed a 15.5 inch bass (pic is comming).  Sign me up for next year
Great numbers Ryan!!!  Looking forward to the full report.  Congrats on yet another successfull Fish-A-Thon!!
Thanks!!!!  The fish caught will just be a bonus, looking forward to meeting a bunch of board members...although with Rick and Vince's wager, I'm going to do my best to catch a good one!!

ALRIGHT! I'm officially in Fish-A-Thon mode for the next 28 hours or so.  We've got a bunch more prizes which I'll post shortly, and I'll include a few other things to go over for you guys!  So far the pledges are flooding in all around, and we're shaping up to have an awesome day.  We just have to cross our fingers for decent weather!  I just have to run out and get some tables and chairs and a second BBQ then I'll get back to you guys with a bunch of details!  Please stay tuned!  Cheers, Ryan
Any details, yet, Ryan?  We are pretty much loaded up and ready to go for tomorrow.
Good luck to all the participants tomorrow Sounds like it's going to be an awesome time Tight lines Leechman
Typing some things out as we speak!

I'm going to keep this short and sweet as I still have to pack up my boat and such!  Time:  Our sort of official start is 8 a.m. but you don't have to kill yourself and get there for 7 or anything... arriving at 8 is OK!  We'll spend a few minutes meeting one another, getting our shirts, launching boats and so on!  The park is charging the standard $10 fee per vehicle, but they likely won't be there when we arrive so just come on in and head down to wards the launch.  We're going to have a Big Fish prize, and I'll go over those details in the morning, but remember to BRING A CAMERA!  We're giving everybody measuring tapes (special thanks to T.J. and Ontariofishing.net for them! )  I'm hoping to set up a spot to meet for lunch and talk about what's working and what isn't.   Then we'll go back to fishing until the BBQ and prize part of the day!  In the event that it's raining on and off which is a definite possibility I'm going to set something up at the conservation area where people can come in and warm up and or dry off.  If this does happen, the BBQ and Prizes will likely happen at the park rather than my place because they have a covered pavilion.  Weather permitting, we'll stop fishing with just enough time to get all the boats out and head over to my place for the post fish-a-thon festivities!  I'm going to have everything from burgers and hot dogs, to salads and fruit trays so you don't want to miss out on the BBQ part of the day!  Things to remember:  1) Sun Screen 2) water 3) snacks 4) Lunch 5) Rain Coats 6) cell phone if you have one 7) CAMERA 8) a pee bucket! haha   they have out-houses at the park 9) bathing suits in case it happens to be warm enough 10) your pledge forms and money 11) towels 12) what am I missing?? fill in the blanks for me guys!  I'm going to try to be on the water for 5 a.m. myself as I'd like to see what they're eating and figure out the most sheltered parts of the lake in the event that it's windy....  Remember, the temperature will have dropped significantly in a short amount of time, so the fish are going to be slow moving and a little more tight lipped.  Small and Slow baits SHOULD be the ticket like Shawn said, but we'll try to figure them out!  Fire off any questions you have!  Can't wait t'il morning!  Cheers, RYan

Sounds, excellent...don't forget your licenses and operator cards as well.  We will see you in the morning...probably around 7:30 or so.  Get some sleep, dude, if you are hitting the water at 5!!!!!!!!
Does it get choppy?Im going to have both my girls in the swamp fox! This will be interesting! Im sure they will have a great time as will I! BTW Frank,Ive got ten bucks riding on you! Honest!

No worries buddy, we'd have to be in a hurricane to get white caps on that lake! haha  even if it was really windy there's a whole bunch of little sheltered fingers off the sides of hte lake to go fish... I'll go over some maps with you guys in the morning...  cheers, Ryan
Would it be advisible to bring a tent?Just in case!
if you want to and have room for it ya might as well throw it in the car!

Special thanks to a few more sponsors!  We'll get all of our amazing prize donators and sponsors posted up on our final Fish-A-Thon Thread, but for now here's a few that came in this afternoon....  Over 30 Facts of Fishing T-shirts AND a gear prize pack from Dave Mercer Outdoors Inc.     A hand-made lure kit from our friend Jacques here on OFC!    Some amazing hand built musky / pike baits, and stickers from OFC member Clive and www.fishingfury.com    A $20.00 Time Horton's cash card donated by my personal friend and member of OFC,  FishnSled... He also made a $50.00 pledge!   And these were actually meant for last years event but we didn't manage to connect until recently, but thanks GBW for 2 Samsung MP3 Players...   Event's like this couldn't happen without the help and support from sponsors and donations like this!  More prizes were picked up by Shawn and Dan and will be highlighted in our post event reports!  See you all in the morning.  Cheers, Ryan
Well I'm at the cottage and the steam whistle's a flowin', see ya'll in the morning.
Ryan pretty much summed it up...the reservoir doesn't get rough...last year we (Juli the boys and I) actually fished it in inflatable boats we bought at Walmart!! See you all in the AM!!!!!!!!

well i'm hittin' the hay guys! my 4 a.m. wake up call is going to come fast and furious (not much of a morning guy... unless i'm going fishing) See you all in the a.m.  Call my cell or fire me a PM or e-mail if you have any issues finding the park.... i'll keep checking my phone.  cheers, Ryan
4:20 a.m. - she's a little windy out there this morning guy so bring some warmer clothes just in case!  See you shortly  Cheers, Ryan
Have a wonderful day for a wonderful cause out there today folks. Enjoy yourselves.
Thanks Roy!  Cross your fingers that the weather turns out OK for us!d
Thanks Roy!
Sooo tired!!! See ya in a few.
on our way!! see ya all there!!
First fish of the 2010 fishathon for cancer!!!! An awesome 24 inched... Measured it!    See you guys on the water!
I have to cancel, family obligations.
Looks like I'm gonna be late Seems I severely underestimated how long it would take to get there I'm burnin rubber though Hope I won't be too tardy.......

Well if all I have to show for a day on the water is a 10.5" rock bass and $4500 raised for cancer I would say that it was a very successful day!! Good job everyone! Can't wait till next year (and maybe nicer weather?) Later!
FYI, you might want to call ahead. Sleded's shirt size is "tarp".. they might not make them that big?
Ryan is away until Friday, let me know if you need anything
Another $100 pledge from Juli's mom!!!  Thanks Judi

Ok quick question for you Dan...Having never been to this lake what is the launch like there? Im wondering if we should be there an hour or so early to get launched? were bringing a 12 ft tinny so if its real busy we could just toss it in anywhere. what are your thoughts on this? Do we start at 8 am sharp?

I can give you a decent answer on that one...the launch isn't usually that busy.  Remember there are no gas motors allowed on the lake, so it cuts down on boat traffic considerably.  There is a decent grade heading down to the lake, but, you could walk a 12 fter in fairly easily. Looks like we are going to have quite the cold front rolling through, so, super-slow presentations this weekend. I'll let Dan or Ryan help out more with the time...I'm not sure what time the gatehouse will be open.

Not sure exactly what time we are starting at but the ramp will not be busy. We will probably be the only ones launching at that time. I will be there probably an hour early getting things ready to go.
How's there pledges coming? I'm over $300 now
Nice, Dan!!  I'm at about $200...Juli is up to close to $400, I think, with a few more people to pledge (she's smoking me!!!!!)
NICE
Great Job everyone its nice to see so many helping out cant wait for the pics and stories next week

Hey guys!!! I just got off the water after a tough day at the office... Haha I'm on my phone so I'll keep this short and get back to you all on Friday when I'm home.  Our start time is 8 am for those who can make it there on time.  I'm thinking it'll likely take us a good half hour or so to get everyone launched.  I'm going to try to be there for around 6:30 so I can help get organized.  The news paper is goin to be there shortly after 8 for a picture of the group and to ask a few questions for their write up.  I'll get y'all all the info you need on Friday!  The park is charging us 10 bucks per vehicle.... The gates are open all night and we can pay on out way out..  Keep up the awesome work!  Thanks again for everything!  Cheers, Ryan
About 300 smackaroos in less than 24hrs!My girls raised 23 in 15 minutes tonight Im so proud of them!
im at around 200 myself!! We will be there shortly after 7 am,will be happy to lend a hand with anything ,see ya then guys!!
Got an awesome package from luremaking.com today and going to pickup a TON of Knock Out Lures in 8 minutes

I was thinking of bringing my video camera and doing a short vid on youtube. Is this ok with all involved? I dont want to be that pesky guy with the video camera. Besides ill need to record the bigest fish I catch!!   were so excited for this one! im up to $220.00 in pledges..who hoo!

Frank - do you mean to say she out fishes and out pledges you? I'll add $10 to your total if you can beat her for biggest fish for the day - you may want to take those lucky pennies away from her Scout's honour....
Put me down for another $10 as well .Now Frank, you have a mission to accomplish! I will be watching I shouldnt kid around,my girls have out fished me on a few occasions!

LOL!!!!!!  Hey, I kicked her butt fishing at Restoule!  She is doing awesome in the pledges...think she is over $450 closing in on $500 now! Thanks, for the offer Rick...I'll do my best to beat her and her deadly new bass combo (involves a crazy electric blue Yum trailer)!

Ah, man they're ganging up on me, now I'll take you up on that as well, Vince!!  Do you know yet, if you will be there for sure??? Tell you and Rick what...if she catches a bigger fish than me, I will add another $20 out of my pocket to the pledges...that way there is another $20 regardless of who gets a bigger fish!!

Well I am speechless with the generosity from all the supporters of this event. Luremaking.com sent the package to me today and I picked up a massive box of spoons from Knock Out Lures today.  Thanks to everyone!
Great, stuff, Dan!!!!  Looks like this year's event is going to top last year's easily!  I'm proud to be a part of it, can't wait to see the final pledge totals!

That's awesome Frankie you and the Wife are kickin butt with the pledges!!! I'm only around $200 so far but todays payday at work so I'm gonna hit every one up again LOL this is gonna be a big year I think I can't wait to find out the totals .
Good Luck to all!!
Nice to meet you Ryan and thanks for picking up those prizes.  I hope you all have a good time.
Nice to finally meet you in person dude! Thanks a bunch for the prizes!

I will be throwing in a $50 pledge plus ill be getting some donations today from my family and my girlfriends family also,We have both lost someone from Cancer in the past,Now its time to put sum $$$ where it counts!!.  Cheers
Awesome man!!! thanks a bunch and keep it up!  Looking forward to next weekend!  Cheers, Ryan
Exactly 1 week from this moment I will be holding up a 7lb monster doing a dance in the boat!
Well if ya ask really nicely I might let ya hold the hawg I'm gonna catch LOL.
Like this one?
I can honestly say I've never caught 1 that size
Less than a week to go...so bump, again.  We're bringing the boys along for the day as well.  Great to see so many OFNers contributing/pledging/offering up prize packs!!  Way to go everyone

Hey guys! We potentially have 20 or more fish-a-thoner's taking part, and prizes donated from a whole bunch of awesome sponsors!  I'll get you all an updated report as soon as time permits!  Right now I'm busy drinking coors light and bbq'ing... Thanks a bunch for all the help and support!  Cheers, Ryan
Oh and Frankie, I have some cool stuff booked for the kids during the BBQ! There's also supposed to be a few other young ones coming who are the same ate as your boys!!
Sounds great, Ryan!!  Don't want to jinx it, but, last time I checked the weather is shaping up nicely for the day, as well!

Hope the weekend goes great guys maybe next year I will see when it is or if there is a date picked a bit early we will come up and camp for the weekend I am sure i can find a 12' tinny some where for the weekend.
PM sent!

My Gran succumbed to cancer after battling for about three years and I would love to pledge some moolah for the cause. Plus gettin another day on the water sounds quite fantastic too!! I just need to know how to go about it! Also, I'm waiting on a msg back from Urban Fisherman to confirm that I'm registered for the day! Can't wait!

Hey dude!  Sorry to hear about your Gram!  That's what started this whole thing for me.. my Wife's Grandma who passed away shortly after last years fish-athon.  I just shot you an e-mail with the pledge form and some more info.  Drop me a line if you have any more questions!  Thanks a bunch for taking part!  Cheers, Ryan
Hey Gang!  20+ Fish-A-Thoner's confirmed, and prizes are coming in by mail daily!  Thanks again for all your time and support and keep it up!  Cheers, Ryan
That's great, Ryan!!  Back at work, trying to get some pledges together...three people so far, not as much as I hoped for, but, it is only Monday.

Special thanks goes out to some of our Fish-A-Thon sponsors!  I received some wicked prizes today from T.J. and OntarioFishing.net.  As well as some awesome tool sets from an Anonymous prize donator.  THANKS T.J. - Your donations from Ontario Fishing.net is awesome!  Check out the website when you guys get a chance!  www.ontariofishing.net   And thanks to an Anonymous prize donator who put together all these tool sets.  There's also a couple of hats that I forgot to add into the picture!!!!  It's great to have some prizes that aren't fishing related as well!    There's more coming in the mail this week but I'm going to be on a "business trip" until friday....    haha So I'll get some pictures up of the rest of hte prizes when I return home!  Thanks again and can't wait to see you all next saturday!  Cheers, Ryan

OK, I scanned a map of the lake for those who haven't fished it before.  Also, we're going to run the "big fish" or derby the same way we did last year with pictures and measuring tapes etc.  I have print out's here for you guys to place in the pictures with your catches.  We're still working out hte details but I want to make sure all you fish-a-thoner's remember to bring camera's!  Here's the map!   Cheers, Ryan
bump
I was just out getting some pledges was out and about for about an hour and have about 100.00 of pledges so far. just a note every little bit helps it all adds up  get out there and get pledges
Nice job!  I have a feeling that I will be hurting that morning. 3 of us at the cottage + beer =   lol  Pledges are coming in fast
Lets hit puslinch Dan,hungover and all!
Ryan, good news! Check your pm!
Good work man keep it up!!!!
Thanks Buddy!  The pledge is VERY much appreciated!   :thumbsup_anim:

Hey Ryan  Im down for that FISH A THON,And im working on getting sum pledges also. I sent you a pm on monday dont know if you got it though.Just need a pledge form or i can get a copy from TB4ME.My shirt size is xl. It should be a great day of fishing. Cant wait!

Hi DrewBrew!  Thanks a bunch for taking part as a fish-a-thoner!    :thumbsup_anim:   I just fired you off a PM.  Sorry I didn't get back to you last night I had a few things on the go... I got your shirt size, just need your name in that PM so I can add you to the list!  Cheers, Ryan
Ok ill fire ya a message thanks.
EVERYONE - Port Rowan Bay Fest is also that weekend, so the rest of the family can enjoy rides and other things while you spend the day fishing.  http://www.go-bayfest.ca/DailyEvents.html

Good Call Dan!  I already got "you're doing the fish-a-thon during bayfest?" from the entire family... To me it's 9 hours on the water one day, followed by BBQ and Beers with fellow fisherpeople... then a day at the fair with my family... good weekend if you ask me!
You only need one day at Bayfest and Sunday is the best anyway.
YO YO YO GOOOOOOOD morning OFC.  Just bumpin' the Fish-A-Thon for Cancer thread up.  Any pledger's in the house today?  Thanks again guys!  Cheers, Ryan
someone's cheery

Special Thanks goes out to one extremely generous, ANONYMOUS pledger who just made a $100.00 pledge to the 2010 Fish-A-Thon for Cancer!  You know who you are and I can't thank you enough!  Cheers, Ryan
Another generous donation from      If it wasn't for my wife I would spend all my money at luremaking.com
Ryan, little package is in the mail.... expect it next Tuesday Good luck to all the participants PM sent Jacques
We still good for Friday Ryan? Headhunter will be there too (I work with the grumpy bugger )
here's the prize pack Joslyn at Angling Outfitters has donated for us particapants .          and here's some stuff I had kickin around that I don't use so I threw it in also .
PM sent...
AWESOME!  Thanks for the offer Clive! (fishing fury) I know you make some first class baits and can't wait to see them in person!  Cheers, Ryan
Special thanks to Mike P. - One of our local Musky experts for donating a couple of sweet lookin' hand-made musky lures!    Thanks buddy!  Cheers, Ryan
Awesome! Thanks a bunch Jacques!  I can't wait to see your handy work in person!   :thumbsup_anim:  Cheers, Ryan

Good to see things are progressing well with the Fish-a-Thon.  Our family is looking forward to participating, and, things have hit close to home with us yesterday.  On the way back from Restoule, Juli's eldest boy got a text saying that her other son's, Ceagan, good friend and classmate Jacob (of Jacob's story) had passed away after his battle with Leukemia.  We had just stopped for lunch in South River, and, the boys were pretty upset, but, we concentrated on how strong a little boy Jacob was.  Keep up the great work guys/gals!!!
Package sent today!
Oh Ya.. im in for a $50 pledge as well
Awesome T.J.  you da man!
bump
Ah Man!  I had a partner and everything and was getting all rev'd up for this, but sadly it's on the long-weekend and I already have prior engagements.  Wish I could be there . . . next year!
Awesome Dan thanks! So how does it work? Do we keep what we catch for weigh in? Well be in a canoe so stringers will have to do. I dont want to kill the fish we keep. Will pics suffice?
Well work something out with pictures!  But there's plenty of panfish, stocker trout and small bass that are good for the frying pan if you're into that!  Thanks again guys! Ryan

Tb4me I think that's how we did it last year but it was a tough day of fishing I think we should go by inches and everyone bring a tape measure and camera so if any big hawgs get caught they don't get stressed out and can be released right away some of those big bass are really old and it would be a shame to lose 1.   Hey Ryan cindy and dean Franklin from the TBBA have commited to donating some stuff for prizes that I will pick up next sunday also angling outfitters in woodstock has also commited to a prize pack I will let ya know what exactly both are next monday at the latest still waiting on a couple other places to get back to me this week I will keep ya updated.
sounds good to me! We should have a card to put in the photo's isued in the morning b4 we start. Lookin forward to it big time!
Hi Ryan:  The little battery sounds good.  Shirt size for me will be Large.  For Dutchy will be XXXL.  If he doesn't come, I will bring another fishing friend.(Rusty ?)  Thanks  ron
Awesome Shawn!

OK fish-a-thoners my brother Brian will be coming and I am gonna use his pond crawler so I have my 16' sportspal availible if some one needs a canoe my bro bought a 14' tinner so he's using that let me know if anyone wants to use it bring your own trolling motor or paddles though shoot me a PM if you need it I don't think we will need any rentals from the responce

Ron - Awesome man keep me posted about Dutchy or whomever else ends up coming out with you!  I want to make sure we have enough shirts and what not.  Shawn - you are simply the man!  Prize donations, bringing in other fish-a-thon'ers, offering up your boat...   :thumbsup_anim:  Events like this only happen because of the kindness and generosity of guys like yourself!  Thanks for everything and make sure you bro fires me off an e-mail or something.  For everybody else - let me know if you need anything at all!  Cheers, Ryan

Two More Prize Donations:  Toronto_Angler has offered up a WFN T-shirt!! Thanks a bunch!  And we've received another Anonymous Prize Donation but we're still working on the details!  Can't thank you guys enough!    :thumbsup_anim:  Cheers, Ryan
Another Fish-A-Thoner!!!!  Welcome to the team HTHM! ( Hometown Handyman )  Looking forward to hitting the lake with you in a couple of weeks!  Cheers, Ryan
Ryan, when are you going to be downtown TO next?  I still have last years MP3 player prizes for you. Geoff
Hey Geoff! I'll be downtown next week! Fire me a pm when you have a chance
PM sent, cheers!

Hey Ryan.... good on you for getting this great event under way Wish I could join you guys.... would be awesome but being so far away thought I'd donate some of my wooden lures I made last year for table prize.  So a little wooden crate is coming your way.... you can call it Leechman's bass kit Sent ya a PM Good luck to all participants Tight lines Jacques
id like Leechmans Bass kit for the event..lol
That's awesome Jacques
Thanks to Doug Hamilton for a $50.00 pledge to the Fish-A-Thon!     Wish you could have made it out this year buddy!

Big Bass Rich is looking into getting us some Burgers and Hot-dogs for the BBQ again this year!  Thanks buddy!    If anyone else has any leads of food that'd be great!  My father-in-law is looking into some meat from one of the companies he does work for as well!  Cheers, Ryan
Me too, but what can you do
What good is Donkey without Shrek   jk

Good Morning Folks!  We've got 17 Fish-A-Thon participants confirmed!!!  And a whole pile of great prizes for both the participants and eligible pledgers!  We could really use some Pledge donations at this point so if any of you guys are on the fence take th plunge and make whatever sort of pledge you can afford!  Every bit helps once you pool it together and it truly is a worthy cause.  Thanks again for all the support OFC!  Cheers, Ryan
Im at $100.00 already including $40.00 from Spincast! Anyone else wanna pledge from around the Brantford area all gladly come pick up your cash guys!
PM Sent.

Okay hopefully I've gotten some attention from my "HELP" title.   Things are going to happen much more fast and furious than I had hopped or planned.  We are going to go with September 4th as our date, which means short notice and only 2 weeks to get pledges and prizes organized.  Why so last minute on my end?  To much on the go in my life right now which I don't really want to jump the gun on talking about, but the last thing I want to see happen is for the fish-a-thon to get passed up on it's second year.  We've gotten some AWESOME prize donations to date, but are much farther behind on pledges at this time, so if you're able to make a prize donation or pledge of ANY KIND, please shoot me a PM and we'll set something up.  Pledger's will have their name put into a draw for a real nice prize!  Here's the deal:  Date: September 4th 2010  Location: Deer Creek Conservation Area  Times: 8 a.m. until 5 P.m. (for those who can make the entire day)  BBQ: 5:30 We'll have a BBQ, Bonfire and Prizes ( you can bring your family and or kids as we'll have a Kids Bouncy Castle set up as well )  Prizes: There will be various prizes for Fish-A-Thon participants as well as a chance for Pledgers to win something nice.  We have to wait until later in the week to decide what exactly will be given out for what and who, as we're still getting donations at this time.  Fish-A-Thon participants: Need to get a pledge form from me or Dan ASAP and we'll need your T-Shirt Size.  Get as many pledges as possible, and also try to get friends or family members involved.  I will be on the lake the next two weeks so I'll try to zero in on some fish and figure out some patters to help get everybody into some decent catches.  We'll have a tournament style day again with a chance at a prize.  The later date might make the bass bite a little tougher, but the trout bite will pick up for sure with cooler temps.  Lastly I started a new thread in hopes that it get's a little more love and attention if I just keep bumping it up...  Here's some catches from Deer Creek.  Most of the time you can't get into the lake with motors on your boats so this is an opportunity for you guys to fish a great little lake no matter the size of your vessel!                                  Last Years Prizes and Winners:           The Gang:        The Lake:          And the woman who caused me to start this Fish-A-Thon.  Irene Anderson who passed away shortly after last years event from Cancer.
PM sent, Ryan!
Don't forget about these guys

Juli and I are in.     We will start getting some pledges as soon as we're back from Restoule. Come on guys/gals let's get some people signed up, been PM'ing back and forth with Ryan...this is a great cause/family event. Cancer has hit close to home for many, if not all, of us. What better way to raise money than doing something all of us here on the OFC love!!!
Awesome Frank!
BTW 2 guys from my shop are coming

DANG!!!!  I'm booked that day but I'll look into changing that.  Really want to try and get down to this Ryan.  If I can't make it I'll help out in some way or another.  Should know by early next week, if not sooner.
SLACKER! Why didn't you tell me when we talked earlier?    Thanks bro - very much appreciated.  Remember to get me all the names and shirt sizes when you're home and have time!  Cheers, Ryan
done, I'm going smallie hunting after work and won't have time

Hey Buddy!  Hopefully you can make it out, not just because of the fish-a-thon but it'd be nice to actually get to see you and spend some time hanging out!  Let me know ASAP!  You're more than welcome to crash out here the night before if you need to!  Cheers, Ryan
It certainly would be nice to hang out, thanks for the offer Ryan.  Will let you know ASAP.

Few questions for a newbie? How much is the entry and where is this lake? Im interested. Does anybody have room for one more on thier boat? My boat is north at the trailer..Awesome event id love to go!
Special Thanks to fishingBill for making a PM donation!    :thumbsup_anim:

Entry to the park is usually $10.00 but I'm trying to get them to wave that fee or at least discount it.  As for the fish-a-thon there's no "entry fee" other than to try and get some pledges with your pledge form.  Just like a walk-a-thon if you've ever participated in one or made a donation.  The lake is about 25 minutes southeast of Tillsonburg, Ontario towards Long point.  And I'll see what we can do about getting you on the water!  Cheers, Ryan
Wow! Some decent bass and nice trout! Is there any rentals in that lake? Hope the fish a thon is a success!
Canoe rentals only...electric motors only on other boats.
Yeah like Frankie said, only canoe rentals, and aside from my fish-a-thon you're not allowed any gas motors on the lake. Not even trimmed up....
Good Morning Folks! Anyone else interested?  We could use a few more fish-a-thon'ers!  Ron where are ya buddy? haha

I am definately in Ryan.  This Fish A Thon has a lot more personal meaning to it for me this year. I jsut posted on the board the passing of my closest friend(Hutch) on Monday.  I think Dutchy is coming too, and this year we have my "new to me" tinnie. I think I will get you to show me how to use the depth finder I bought off you last year too.  See u soon bro

YO YO Ron!  So very sorry to hear about your friend!  Much love from my family to yours!  Let me know if you want the little battery and I'll bring it out and give it to you for the hard water season!  Also what size shirt are you and if you're talking to Dutchy have him let me know ASAP if he'll be able to make it!  If you need a pledge form let us know!  Thanks man - and looking forward to seeing you again!  Cheers, Ryan

Ok Guys!  So far we have 11 Participants confirmed - that's one short from last year!  And awesome prize donations from:  - Dave Mercer Outdoors Inc. Awesome Prize Pack & Shirts!  - TJ (the godfather of OFC  ) Ontario Fishing.net Swag!  - Lloyd - U & Me guiding service  $350 value guided trip!  -  Knock Out Lures - Spoon Prize pack!  - Mike P. from OFC - Donated Musky Baits!  OFC Private Pledges: I know times are tough guys - but if you can skip a timmies one morning every bit helps our cause!  FishingBill - Thanks for your pledge!  Your donations and support are appreciated more than you can all imagine!  Thanks to everybody for all your help and support!
Cant wait man should be a good time!!
Hey Ryan I think I have another guy (with a canoe) convinced to join us. He isint an OFC member is that ok? He will be after this im sure!
Doesn't need to be an OFC'r. There are guys from another board coming as well as guys who barely fish. Everybody is welcome
